properties.value:
<!--
    IMPORTANT:
    - Policy elements can appear only within the <inbound>, <outbound>, <backend> section elements.
    - Only the <forward-request> policy element can appear within the <backend> section element.
    - To apply a policy to the incoming request (before it is forwarded to the backend service), place a corresponding policy element within the <inbound> section element.
    - To apply a policy to the outgoing response (before it is sent back to the caller), place a corresponding policy element within the <outbound> section element.
    - To add a policy position the cursor at the desired insertion point and click on the round button associated with the policy.
    - To remove a policy, delete the corresponding policy statement from the policy document.
    - Policies are applied in the order of their appearance, from the top down.
-->
<policies>
  <inbound>
    <cors allow-credentials="true">
      <allowed-origins>
        <origin>https://jp-dev-apinewdeveloper.ap.manulife.com</origin>
      </allowed-origins>
      <allowed-methods preflight-result-max-age="300">
        <method>*</method>
      </allowed-methods>
      <allowed-headers>
        <header>*</header>
      </allowed-headers>
      <expose-headers>
        <header>*</header>
      </expose-headers>
    </cors>
  </inbound>
  <backend>
    <forward-request />
  </backend>
  <outbound />
</policies>

properties.description: Subscribers will be able to access DEV APIs
properties.terms: As per Manulife Japan security access policies

properties.description: Subscribers will be able to run 5 calls/minute up to a maximum of 100 calls/week.
Subscribers have completely unlimited access to the API. Administrator approval is required.

properties.subject: Thank you for using the $OrganizationName API!
properties.body:
Dear $DevFirstName $DevLastName,

On behalf of $OrganizationName and our customers we thank you for giving us a try. Your $OrganizationName API account is now closed.

Thank you,

Your $OrganizationName Team

$DevPortalUrl
properties.title: Developer farewell letter
properties.description: Developers receive this farewell email after they close their account.

properties.subject: Your application $AppName is published in the application gallery
properties.body:
Dear $DevFirstName $DevLastName,

We are happy to let you know that your request to publish the $AppName application in the application gallery has been approved. Your application has been published and can be viewed here.

Best,

The $OrganizationName API Team
properties.title: Application gallery submission approved
properties.description: Developers who submitted their application for publication in the application gallery on the developer portal receive this email after their submission is approved.

properties.subject: Please confirm your new $OrganizationName API account
properties.body:
Dear $DevFirstName $DevLastName,

Thank you for joining the $OrganizationName API program! We host a growing number of cool APIs and strive to provide an awesome experience for API developers.

First order of business is to activate your account and get you going. To that end, please click on the following link:

$ConfirmUrl

If clicking the link does not work, please copy-and-paste or re-type it into your browser's address bar and hit "Enter".

Thank you,

$OrganizationName API Team

$DevPortalUrl

Please click on the following link to confirm the change:

If clicking the link does not work, please copy-and-paste or re-type it into your browser's address bar and hit "Enter".

Thank you,

$OrganizationName API Team

$CommentText

To view the issue on the developer portal click here.

Best,

The $OrganizationName API Team
properties.title: New comment added to an issue
properties.description: Developers receive this email when someone comments on the issue they created on the Issues page of the developer portal.

properties.subject: Welcome to the $OrganizationName API!
properties.body:
Welcome to $OrganizationName API!

Dear $DevFirstName $DevLastName,

Your $OrganizationName API program registration is completed and we are thrilled to have you as a customer. Here are a few important bits of information for your reference:

#if ($IdentityProvider == "Basic") #else #end
Please use the following username when signing into any of the ${OrganizationName}-hosted developer portals: $DevUsername Please use the following $IdentityProvider account when signing into any of the ${OrganizationName}-hosted developer portals: $DevUsername
We will direct all communications to the following email address: $DevEmail

Best of luck in your API pursuits!

$OrganizationName API Team

$DevPortalUrl
properties.title: Developer welcome letter
properties.description: Developers receive this “welcome” email after they confirm their new account.

The $OrganizationName API Team

properties.description: Developers receive this email when they request a password change of their account. The purpose of the email is to verify that the account owner made the request and to provide a one-time perishable URL for changing the password.

properties.subject: Your subscription to the $ProdName
properties.body:
Greetings $DevFirstName $DevLastName!

Thank you for subscribing to the $ProdName and welcome to the $OrganizationName developer community. We are delighted to have you as part of the team and are looking forward to the amazing applications you will build using our API!

Below are a few subscription details for your reference:

    #if ($SubStartDate != "")
  • Start date: $SubStartDate
    • #end #if ($SubTerm != "")
  • Subscription term: $SubTerm
    • #end

Visit the developer profile area to manage your subscription and subscription keys

A couple of pointers to help get you started:

Learn about the API

The API documentation provides all information necessary to make a request and to process a response. Code samples are provided per API operation in a variety of languages. Moreover, an interactive console allows making API calls directly from the developer portal without writing any code.

Feature your app in the app gallery

You can publish your application on our gallery for increased visibility to potential new users.

Stay in touch

If you have an issue, a question, a suggestion, a request, or if you just want to tell us something, go to the Issues page on the developer portal and create a new topic.

Happy hacking,

The $OrganizationName API Team

$DevPortalUrl
properties.title: New subscription activated
properties.description: Developers receive this acknowledgement email after subscribing to a product.

properties.subject: You are approaching an API quota limit
properties.body:
Greetings $DevFirstName $DevLastName!

You are approaching the quota limit on you subscription to the $ProdName product (primary key $SubPrimaryKey). #if ($QuotaResetDate != "") This quota will be renewed on $QuotaResetDate. #else This quota will not be renewed. #end

Below are details on quota usage for the subscription:

#foreach ($api in $Apis) #foreach ($operation in $api.Operations) #end #end
Quota Scope Calls Call Quota Bandwidth Bandwidth Quota
Subscription #if ($CallsAlert == true) $Calls #else $Calls #end $CallQuota #if ($BandwidthAlert == true) $Bandwidth #else $Bandwidth #end $BandwidthQuota
API: $api.Name #if ($api.CallsAlert == true) $api.Calls #else $api.Calls #end $api.CallQuota #if ($api.BandwidthAlert == true) $api.Bandwidth #else $api.Bandwidth #end $api.BandwidthQuota
Operation: $operation.Name #if ($operation.CallsAlert == true) $operation.Calls #else $operation.Calls #end $operation.CallQuota #if ($operation.BandwidthAlert == true) $operation.Bandwidth #else $operation.Bandwidth #end $operation.BandwidthQuota

Thank you,

$OrganizationName API Team

$DevPortalUrl
properties.title: Developer quota limit approaching notification
properties.description: Developers receive this email to alert them when they are approaching a quota limit.

properties.subject: Your subscription request for the $ProdName
properties.body:
Dear $DevFirstName $DevLastName,

We would like to inform you that we reviewed your subscription request for the $ProdName.

#if ($SubDeclineReason == "")

Regretfully, we were unable to approve it, as subscriptions are temporarily suspended at this time.

#else

Regretfully, we were unable to approve it at this time for the following reason:

$SubDeclineReason

#end

We truly appreciate your interest.

All the best,

The $OrganizationName API Team

$DevPortalUrl
properties.title: Subscription request declined
properties.description: This email is sent to developers when their subscription requests for products requiring publisher approval is declined.

properties.subject: Your subscription request for the $ProdName
properties.body:

Thank you for your interest in our $ProdName API product!

We were delighted to receive your subscription request. We will promptly review it and get back to you at $DevEmail.

Thank you,

The $OrganizationName API Team

$DevPortalUrl

properties.value:
<!--
    IMPORTANT:
    - Policy elements can appear only within the <inbound>, <outbound>, <backend> section elements.
    - To apply a policy to the incoming request (before it is forwarded to the backend service), place a corresponding policy element within the <inbound> section element.
    - To apply a policy to the outgoing response (before it is sent back to the caller), place a corresponding policy element within the <outbound> section element.
    - To add a policy, place the cursor at the desired insertion point and select a policy from the sidebar.
    - To remove a policy, delete the corresponding policy statement from the policy document.
    - Position the <base> element within a section element to inherit all policies from the corresponding section element in the enclosing scope.
    - Remove the <base> element to prevent inheriting policies from the corresponding section element in the enclosing scope.
    - Policies are applied in the order of their appearance, from the top down.
    - Comments within policy elements are not supported and may disappear. Place your comments between policy elements or at a higher level scope.
-->
<policies>
  <inbound>
    <choose>
      <when condition="@((context.Request.Body) != null)">
        <set-variable name="body" value="@(context.Request.Body.As<string>(preserveContent: true))" />
        <set-variable name="requestDataCheck" value="@{
 
                    // XML well formed parsing check
                    XDocument xDoc = context.Request.Body.As<XDocument>(preserveContent: true);

                    String usernameVal = "";
                    String passwordVal = "";
                    String chanelId    = "";
                    String insCliID    = "";
                    String prodID      = "";
                    String contractID  = "";
                    String planCD      = "";
 
                    // WS-Security Username token check
                    try {
                        usernameVal = xDoc.Root.Element("{http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/}Header").Element("{http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-wssecurity-secext-1.0.xsd}Security").Element("{http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-wssecurity-secext-1.0.xsd}UsernameToken").Element("{http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-wssecurity-secext-1.0.xsd}Username").Value.ToString();
                        passwordVal = xDoc.Root.Element("{http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/}Header").Element("{http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-wssecurity-secext-1.0.xsd}Security").Element("{http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-wssecurity-secext-1.0.xsd}UsernameToken").Element("{http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-wssecurity-secext-1.0.xsd}Password").Value.ToString();
                       
                        if ( !(usernameVal.Equals("{{InWSSecUser}}")) || !(passwordVal.Equals("{{InWSSecPass}}")) ) {
                            throw new Exception ("ws-security invalid username token");
                        }
                    } catch (Exception e) {
                        throw new Exception("AUTHENTICATION-FAILURE: An error occurred in ws-security username token verification", e);
                    }
                   
                    // REQ-KEY-INFO capture
                    try {
                        chanelId    = xDoc.Root.Element("{http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/}Body").Element("{http://jp.co.manulife.spi.services.salescondpremcheckservice}SPISalesCondPremCheckServiceRequest").Element("{http://jp.co.manulife.spi.services.salescondpremcheckservice}BasicInfoDetails").Element("{http://jp.co.manulife.spi.services.salescondpremcheckservice}ChannelID").Value.ToString();
                        insCliID    = xDoc.Root.Element("{http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/}Body").Element("{http://jp.co.manulife.spi.services.salescondpremcheckservice}SPISalesCondPremCheckServiceRequest").Element("{http://jp.co.manulife.spi.services.salescondpremcheckservice}InsuredInfo").Element("{http://jp.co.manulife.spi.services.salescondpremcheckservice}InsuredDetails").Element("{http://jp.co.manulife.spi.services.salescondpremcheckservice}InsuredInfoClientID").Value.ToString();
                        prodID      = xDoc.Root.Element("{http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/}Body").Element("{http://jp.co.manulife.spi.services.salescondpremcheckservice}SPISalesCondPremCheckServiceRequest").Element("{http://jp.co.manulife.spi.services.salescondpremcheckservice}PolicyInfo").Element("{http://jp.co.manulife.spi.services.salescondpremcheckservice}PolicyDetails").Element("{http://jp.co.manulife.spi.services.salescondpremcheckservice}ProductID").Value.ToString();
                        contractID  = xDoc.Root.Element("{http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/}Body").Element("{http://jp.co.manulife.spi.services.salescondpremcheckservice}SPISalesCondPremCheckServiceRequest").Element("{http://jp.co.manulife.spi.services.salescondpremcheckservice}PolicyInfo").Element("{http://jp.co.manulife.spi.services.salescondpremcheckservice}PolicyDetails").Element("{http://jp.co.manulife.spi.services.salescondpremcheckservice}ContractID").Value.ToString();
                        planCD      = xDoc.Root.Element("{http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/}Body").Element("{http://jp.co.manulife.spi.services.salescondpremcheckservice}SPISalesCondPremCheckServiceRequest").Element("{http://jp.co.manulife.spi.services.salescondpremcheckservice}PolicyInfo").Element("{http://jp.co.manulife.spi.services.salescondpremcheckservice}PolicyDetails").Element("{http://jp.co.manulife.spi.services.salescondpremcheckservice}CoverageInfo").Element("{http://jp.co.manulife.spi.services.salescondpremcheckservice}CoverageDetails").Element("{http://jp.co.manulife.spi.services.salescondpremcheckservice}PlanCode").Value.ToString();
                    }
                    catch (Exception e){
                        throw new Exception("REQUEST-LOGGING-FAILURE: An error occurred while logging request key information", e);
                    }
                   
                    return "MLK_SalesConditionPremCheck, INBOUND, SUCCESS, RequestGUID["+context.RequestId.ToString()+"], ChannelID["+chanelId+"], InsuredID["+insCliID+"], ProductID["+prodID+"], ContractID["+contractID+"], PlanCd["+planCD+"]";
                
                }" />
        <!-- Log REQ-KEY-INFO -->
        <!-- <log-to-eventhub logger-id="jp-manulink-api-logger" partition-id="3">@("{\"LogData\" : \'"+context.Variables["requestDataCheck"]+"\'}")</log-to-eventhub>  -->
      </when>
      <otherwise>
        <return-response>
          <set-status code="500" reason="REQUEST-VALIDATION-FAILED" />
          <set-header name="RequestValidation" exists-action="override">
            <value>RequestValidation="invalid_body"</value>
          </set-header>
          <set-header name="Content-Type" exists-action="override">
            <value>text/xml</value>
          </set-header>
          <set-body template="none">@("<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv='http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/'>"+
                      "<soapenv:Body><soapenv:Fault><faultcode>REQUEST-VALIDATION-FAILED</faultcode>"+
                      "<faultstring>RequestValidation='invalid_body'</faultstring></soapenv:Fault></soapenv:Body></soapenv:Envelope>")</set-body>
        </return-response>
      </otherwise>
    </choose>
    <!-- Update Backend Server Username Token -->
    <find-and-replace from="{{InWSSecUser}}" to="{{MLKUsername}}" />
    <find-and-replace from="{{InWSSecPass}}" to="{{MLKPassword}}" />
    <!-- Set Backend Server Endpoint URL  -->
    <set-backend-service base-url="{{MLKSalesConditionPremCheckURL}}" />
  </inbound>
  <backend>
    <forward-request timeout="120" fail-on-error-status-code="true" />
  </backend>
  <outbound>
    <choose>
      <when condition="@((context.Response.Body) != null)">
        <set-variable name="responseBody" value="@(context.Response.Body.As<string>(preserveContent: true))" />
        <!-- RESP-KEY-INFO capture -->
        <set-variable name="responseDataCheck" value="@{
                    // Add sub-string logic to capture part of respose
                    String respBodyStr      = "";
                    String respPart      = "";
                    respBodyStr = (String)context.Variables["responseBody"]; 
                    respPart = respBodyStr.Substring(100,200);
                    return "MLK_SalesConditionPremCheck, OUTBOUND, SUCCESS, RequestGUID["+context.RequestId.ToString()+"], ResponsePart["+respPart+"]";
                }" />
        <!-- Log RESP-KEY-INFO -->
        <!-- <log-to-eventhub logger-id="jp-manulink-api-logger" partition-id="3">@("{\"LogData\" : \'"+context.Variables["responseDataCheck"]+"\'}")</log-to-eventhub>  -->
      </when>
      <otherwise>
        <set-variable name="responseNullCheck" value="@{  
                    return "MLK_SalesConditionPremCheck, OUTBOUND, FAILURE, RequestGUID["+context.RequestId.ToString()+"], Error[Backend Response Is NULL]";
                }" />
        <!-- <log-to-eventhub logger-id="jp-manulink-api-logger" partition-id="3">@("{\"LogData\" : \'"+context.Variables["responseNullCheck"]+"\'}")</log-to-eventhub>  -->
        <return-response>
          <set-status code="500" reason="BackendResponseIsNull" />
          <set-header name="BackendError" exists-action="override">
            <value>BackendError="backend_response_is_null"</value>
          </set-header>
          <set-header name="Content-Type" exists-action="override">
            <value>text/xml</value>
          </set-header>
          <set-body template="none">@("<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv='http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/'>"+
                      "<soapenv:Body><soapenv:Fault><faultcode>RESPONSE-VALIDATION-FAILED</faultcode>"+
                      "<faultstring>RequestValidation='backend_response_is_null'</faultstring></soapenv:Fault></soapenv:Body></soapenv:Envelope>")</set-body>
        </return-response>
      </otherwise>
    </choose>
  </outbound>
  <on-error>
    <set-variable name="errorCheck" value="@{
            //String ErrorInfo = ""+context.RequestId.ToString()+","+context.LastError.Source+","+context.LastError.Reason+","+context.LastError.Message+","+context.LastError.Section+","+context.LastError.Path;
            return "MLK_SalesConditionPremCheck, ONERROR, FAILURE, RequestGUID["+context.RequestId.ToString()+"], ErrorMessage["+context.LastError.Message+"]";
        }" />
    <!-- <log-to-eventhub logger-id="jp-manulink-api-logger" partition-id="3">@("{\"LogData\" : \'"+context.Variables["errorCheck"]+"\'}")</log-to-eventhub>  -->
    <return-response>
      <set-status code="@(context.Response.StatusCode)" reason="@(context.LastError.Reason)" />
      <set-header name="Content-Type" exists-action="override">
        <value>text/xml</value>
      </set-header>
      <set-header name="RequestGUID" exists-action="override">
        <value>@(context.RequestId.ToString())</value>
      </set-header>
      <set-header name="ErrorSource" exists-action="override">
        <value>@(context.LastError.Source)</value>
      </set-header>
      <set-header name="ErrorReason" exists-action="override">
        <value>@(context.LastError.Reason)</value>
      </set-header>
      <set-header name="ErrorMessage" exists-action="override">
        <value>@(context.LastError.Message)</value>
      </set-header>
      <set-header name="ErrorScope" exists-action="override">
        <value>@(context.LastError.Scope)</value>
      </set-header>
      <set-header name="ErrorSection" exists-action="override">
        <value>@(context.LastError.Section)</value>
      </set-header>
      <set-header name="ErrorPath" exists-action="override">
        <value>@(context.LastError.Path)</value>
      </set-header>
      <set-header name="ErrorStatusCode" exists-action="override">
        <value>@(context.Response.StatusCode.ToString())</value>
      </set-header>
      <set-body template="none">@("<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv='http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/'>"+
               "<soapenv:Body><soapenv:Fault>" +
               "<faultcode>"+context.LastError.Reason+"</faultcode>"+
               "<faultstring>"+context.LastError.Message+"</faultstring>"+
               "<detail>"+"StatusCode:"+context.Response.StatusCode+", ErrorSource:"+context.LastError.Source
                         +", ErrorScope:"+context.LastError.Scope+", ErrorSection:"+context.LastError.Section
                         +", ErrorPath:"+context.LastError.Path
                         +", RequestGUID:"+context.RequestId.ToString()
                         + "</detail>"+
               "</soapenv:Fault></soapenv:Body></soapenv:Envelope>")</set-body>
    </return-response>
  </on-error>
</policies>

        <xsd:extension base="intf:WSSndryAmtUpdtResponse">
          <xsd:anyAttribute namespace="##other" />
        </xsd:extension>
      </xsd:complexContent>
    </xsd:complexType>
  </xsd:element>
  <xsd:complexType name="WSSndryAmtUpdtRequest">
    <xsd:sequence>
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="1" name="ProcessClassID" type="xsd:string" />
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" name="StatisticLogging">
        <xsd:simpleType>
          <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string">
            <xsd:enumeration value="yes" />
          </xsd:restriction>
        </xsd:simpleType>
      </xsd:element>
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" name="BAMID" type="xsd:string" />
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="1" name="MIR-USER-ID">
        <xsd:simpleType>
          <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string">
            <xsd:minLength value="0" />
            <xsd:maxLength value="8" />
          </xsd:restriction>
        </xsd:simpleType>
      </xsd:element>
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="1" name="MIR-USER-PSWD-TXT">
        <xsd:simpleType>
          <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string">
            <xsd:minLength value="0" />
            <xsd:maxLength value="8" />
          </xsd:restriction>
        </xsd:simpleType>
      </xsd:element>
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="1" name="MIR-CO-ID">
        <xsd:simpleType>
          <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string">
            <xsd:minLength value="0" />
            <xsd:maxLength value="2" />
          </xsd:restriction>
        </xsd:simpleType>
      </xsd:element>
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="1" name="LocaleID">
        <xsd:simpleType>
          <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string">
            <xsd:minLength value="0" />
            <xsd:maxLength value="1" />
          </xsd:restriction>
        </xsd:simpleType>
      </xsd:element>
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" name="RequestParameters" type="intf:GroupRequestParametersRequest" />
    </xsd:sequence>
  </xsd:complexType>
  <xsd:complexType name="WSSndryAmtUpdtResponse">
    <xsd:sequence>
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="1" name="Messages" type="intf:GroupContentMessages" />
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" name="ResponseDetails" type="intf:GroupResponseDetailsResponse" />
    </xsd:sequence>
  </xsd:complexType>
  <xsd:complexType name="GroupContentMessages">
    <xsd:sequence>
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="5" minOccurs="0" name="Message" type="intf:GroupContentMessage" />
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="1" name="More">
        <xsd:simpleType>
          <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string">
            <xsd:minLength value="0" />
            <xsd:maxLength value="3" />
          </xsd:restriction>
        </xsd:simpleType>
      </xsd:element>
    </xsd:sequence>
  </xsd:complexType>
  <xsd:complexType name="GroupContentMessage">
    <xsd:sequence>
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="1" name="Id">
        <xsd:simpleType>
          <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string">
            <xsd:minLength value="0" />
            <xsd:maxLength value="100" />
          </xsd:restriction>
        </xsd:simpleType>
      </xsd:element>
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="1" name="Severity">
        <xsd:simpleType>
          <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string">
            <xsd:minLength value="0" />
            <xsd:maxLength value="1" />
          </xsd:restriction>
        </xsd:simpleType>
      </xsd:element>
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="1" name="Content">
        <xsd:simpleType>
          <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string">
            <xsd:minLength value="0" />
            <xsd:maxLength value="100" />
          </xsd:restriction>
        </xsd:simpleType>
      </xsd:element>
    </xsd:sequence>
  </xsd:complexType>
  <xsd:complexType name="GroupRequestParametersRequest">
    <xsd:sequence>
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" name="Agent" type="xsd:string" />
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" name="RequestorType" type="xsd:string" />
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" name="PolicyID" type="xsd:string" />
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" name="EffDt" type="xsd:string" />
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" name="SndryAmt" type="xsd:string" />
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" name="AllocTyp" type="xsd:string" />
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" name="SupresAllocNotiInd" type="xsd:string" />
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" name="AllocAmtTot" type="xsd:string" />
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" name="AllocAmtCvg" type="xsd:string" />
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" name="AllocPctFnd" type="xsd:string" />
    </xsd:sequence>
  </xsd:complexType>
  <xsd:complexType name="GroupResponseDetailsResponse">
    <xsd:sequence>
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" name="PolicyID" type="xsd:string" />
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" name="EffDt" type="xsd:string" />
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" name="SndryAmt" type="xsd:string" />
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" name="AllocTyp" type="xsd:string" />
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" name="SupresAllocNotiInd" type="xsd:string" />
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" name="AllocAmtTot" type="xsd:string" />
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" name="AllocAmtCvg" type="xsd:string" />
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" name="AllocPctFnd" type="xsd:string" />
      <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" name="ReturnCode" type="xsd:string" />
    </xsd:sequence>
  </xsd:complexType>
</xsd:schema>

properties.value:
<!--
            IMPORTANT:
            - Policy elements can appear only within the <inbound>, <outbound>, <backend> section elements.
            - Only the <forward-request> policy element can appear within the <backend> section element.
            - To apply a policy to the incoming request (before it is forwarded to the backend service), place a corresponding policy element within the <inbound> section element.
            - To apply a policy to the outgoing response (before it is sent back to the caller), place a corresponding policy element within the <outbound> section element.
            - To add a policy position the cursor at the desired insertion point and click on the round button associated with the policy.
            - To remove a policy, delete the corresponding policy statement from the policy document.
            - Position the <base> element within a section element to inherit all policies from the corresponding section element in the enclosing scope.
            - Remove the <base> element to prevent inheriting policies from the corresponding section element in the enclosing scope.
            - Policies are applied in the order of their appearance, from the top down.
        -->
<policies>
  <inbound>
    <rate-limit calls="5" renewal-period="60" />
    <quota calls="100" renewal-period="604800" />
    <base />
  </inbound>
  <backend>
    <base />
  </backend>
  <outbound>
    <base />
  </outbound>
</policies>

<!--
    IMPORTANT:
    - Policy elements can appear only within the <inbound>, <outbound>, <backend> section elements.
    - To apply a policy to the incoming request (before it is forwarded to the backend service), place a corresponding policy element within the <inbound> section element.
    - To apply a policy to the outgoing response (before it is sent back to the caller), place a corresponding policy element within the <outbound> section element.
    - To add a policy, place the cursor at the desired insertion point and select a policy from the sidebar.
    - To remove a policy, delete the corresponding policy statement from the policy document.
    - Position the <base> element within a section element to inherit all policies from the corresponding section element in the enclosing scope.
    - Remove the <base> element to prevent inheriting policies from the corresponding section element in the enclosing scope.
    - Policies are applied in the order of their appearance, from the top down.
    - Comments within policy elements are not supported and may disappear. Place your comments between policy elements or at a higher level scope.
-->
<policies>
  <inbound>
    <choose>
      <when condition="@((context.Request.Body) != null)">
        <set-variable name="body" value="@(context.Request.Body.As<string>(preserveContent: true))" />
        <set-variable name="requestDataCheck" value="@{
                    XDocument xDoc = context.Request.Body.As<XDocument>(preserveContent: true);                  
                    String usernameVal = "";
                    String passwordVal = "";
                    String mirUserID    = "";
                    String policyNo    = "";                   
                    try {
                        usernameVal = xDoc.Root.Element("{http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/}Header").Element("{http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-wssecurity-secext-1.0.xsd}Security").Element("{http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-wssecurity-secext-1.0.xsd}UsernameToken").Element("{http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-wssecurity-secext-1.0.xsd}Username").Value.ToString();
                        passwordVal = xDoc.Root.Element("{http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/}Header").Element("{http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-wssecurity-secext-1.0.xsd}Security").Element("{http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-wssecurity-secext-1.0.xsd}UsernameToken").Element("{http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-wssecurity-secext-1.0.xsd}Password").Value.ToString();                       
                        if ( !(usernameVal.Equals("{{InWSSecUser}}")) || !(passwordVal.Equals("{{InWSSecPass}}")) ) {
                            throw new Exception ("ws-security invalid username token");
                        }
                    } catch (Exception e) {
                        throw new Exception("AUTHENTICATION-FAILURE: An error occurred in ws-security username token verification", e);
                    }
                    try {
                        mirUserID = xDoc.Root.Element("{http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/}Body").Element("{http://schema/webservices.elink.solcorp.com}callFlowRequest").Element("MIR-USER-ID").Value.ToString();
                        policyNo = xDoc.Root.Element("{http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/}Body").Element("{http://schema/webservices.elink.solcorp.com}callFlowRequest").Element("RequestParameters").Element("PolicyNumber").Value.ToString();}
                    catch (Exception e){
                        throw new Exception("REQUEST-LOGGING-FAILURE: An error occurred while logging request key information", e);
                    }
                    return "ING_CashSurrdrValue, INBOUND, SUCCESS, RequestGUID["+context.RequestId.ToString()+"], MIR-USER-ID["+mirUserID+"], PolicyNumber["+policyNo+"]";               
                }" />
        <log-to-eventhub logger-id="jp-ingenium-api-logger" partition-id="0">@("{\"LogData\" : \'"+context.Variables["requestDataCheck"]+"\'}")</log-to-eventhub>
      </when>
      <otherwise>
        <return-response>
          <set-status code="500" reason="REQUEST-VALIDATION-FAILED" />
          <set-header name="Content-Type" exists-action="override">
            <value>text/xml</value>
          </set-header>
          <set-body template="none">@("<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv=\"http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/\">\n" + 
				        "   <soapenv:Body>\n" + 
				        "      <soapenv:Fault>\n" + 
				        "         <faultcode>REQUEST-VALIDATION-FAILED</faultcode>\n" + 
				        "         <faultstring>INVALID-BODY</faultstring>\n" + 
				        "      </soapenv:Fault>\n" + 
				        "   </soapenv:Body>\n" + 
				        "</soapenv:Envelope>")</set-body>
        </return-response>
      </otherwise>
    </choose>
    <find-and-replace from="{{InWSSecUser}}" to="{{INGUsername}}" />
    <find-and-replace from="{{InWSSecPass}}" to="{{INGPassword}}" />
    <set-backend-service base-url="{{INGCashSurrdrValueURL}}" />
  </inbound>
  <backend>
    <forward-request timeout="120" fail-on-error-status-code="true" />
  </backend>
  <outbound>
    <choose>
      <when condition="@((context.Response.Body) != null)">
        <set-variable name="responseBody" value="@(context.Response.Body.As<string>(preserveContent: true))" />
        <set-variable name="responseDataCheck" value="@{
                    String respBodyStr      = "";
                    String respPart      = "";
                    respBodyStr = (String)context.Variables["responseBody"]; 
                    respPart = respBodyStr.Substring(100,200);
                    return "ING_CashSurrdrValue, OUTBOUND, SUCCESS, RequestGUID["+context.RequestId.ToString()+"], ResponsePart["+respPart+"]";
                }" />
        <log-to-eventhub logger-id="jp-ingenium-api-logger" partition-id="0">@("{\"LogData\" : \'"+context.Variables["responseDataCheck"]+"\'}")</log-to-eventhub>
      </when>
      <otherwise>
        <set-variable name="responseNullCheck" value="@{  
                    return "ING_CashSurrdrValue, OUTBOUND, FAILURE, RequestGUID["+context.RequestId.ToString()+"], Error[Backend Response Is NULL]";
                }" />
        <log-to-eventhub logger-id="jp-ingenium-api-logger" partition-id="0">@("{\"LogData\" : \'"+context.Variables["responseNullCheck"]+"\'}")</log-to-eventhub>
        <return-response>
          <set-status code="500" reason="BACKEND-RESPONSE-NULL" />
          <set-header name="Content-Type" exists-action="override">
            <value>text/xml</value>
          </set-header>
          <set-body template="none">@("<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv=\"http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/\">\n" + 
				        "   <soapenv:Body>\n" + 
				        "      <soapenv:Fault>\n" + 
				        "         <faultcode>RESPONSE-VALIDATION-FAILED</faultcode>\n" + 
				        "         <faultstring>BACKEND-RESPONSE-NULL</faultstring>\n" + 
				        "      </soapenv:Fault>\n" + 
				        "   </soapenv:Body>\n" + 
				        "</soapenv:Envelope>")</set-body>
        </return-response>
      </otherwise>
    </choose>
  </outbound>
  <on-error>
    <choose>
      <when condition="@((context.Response.Body) != null)">
        <set-variable name="errorResponseBody" value="@(context.Response.Body.As<string>(preserveContent: true))" />
        <choose>
          <when condition="@(((""+context.Variables["errorResponseBody"]).Contains("faultcode")))">
            <set-variable name="soapFaultCheck" value="@{
                            String SoapFaultInfo = ""+context.Variables["errorResponseBody"];
                            return "ING_CashSurrdrValue, ONERROR, FAILURE, RequestGUID["+context.RequestId.ToString()+"], SoapFault["+SoapFaultInfo+"]";
                        }" />
            <log-to-eventhub logger-id="jp-ingenium-api-logger" partition-id="0">@("{\"LogData\" : \'"+context.Variables["soapFaultCheck"]+"\'}")</log-to-eventhub>
          </when>
          <otherwise>
            <set-variable name="errorCheck" value="@{
                            String ErrorInfo = ""+context.LastError.Source+","+context.LastError.Reason+","+context.LastError.Message+","+context.LastError.Section+","+context.LastError.Path;
                            return "ING_CashSurrdrValue, ONERROR, FAILURE, RequestGUID["+context.RequestId.ToString()+"], ErrorMessage["+ErrorInfo+"]";
                        }" />
            <log-to-eventhub logger-id="jp-ingenium-api-logger" partition-id="0">@("{\"LogData\" : \'"+context.Variables["errorCheck"]+"\'}")</log-to-eventhub>
            <return-response>
              <set-status code="@(context.Response.StatusCode)" reason="@(context.LastError.Reason)" />
              <set-header name="Content-Type" exists-action="override">
                <value>text/xml</value>
              </set-header>
              <set-header name="RequestGUID" exists-action="override">
                <value>@(context.RequestId.ToString())</value>
              </set-header>
              <set-header name="ErrorSource" exists-action="override">
                <value>@(context.LastError.Source)</value>
              </set-header>
              <set-header name="ErrorReason" exists-action="override">
                <value>@(context.LastError.Reason)</value>
              </set-header>
              <set-header name="ErrorMessage" exists-action="override">
                <value>@(context.LastError.Message)</value>
              </set-header>
              <set-header name="ErrorScope" exists-action="override">
                <value>@(context.LastError.Scope)</value>
              </set-header>
              <set-header name="ErrorSection" exists-action="override">
                <value>@(context.LastError.Section)</value>
              </set-header>
              <set-header name="ErrorPath" exists-action="override">
                <value>@(context.LastError.Path)</value>
              </set-header>
              <set-header name="ErrorStatusCode" exists-action="override">
                <value>@(context.Response.StatusCode.ToString())</value>
              </set-header>
              <set-body template="none">@("<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv=\"http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/\">\n" + 
				                "   <soapenv:Body>\n" + 
				                "      <soapenv:Fault>\n" + 
				                "         <faultcode>"+context.LastError.Reason+"</faultcode>\n" + 
				                "         <faultstring>"+context.LastError.Message+"</faultstring>\n" + 
                                "           <detail>"+"StatusCode:"+context.Response.StatusCode+", ErrorSource:"+context.LastError.Source +
                                                ", ErrorScope:"+context.LastError.Scope+", ErrorSection:"+context.LastError.Section +
                                                ", ErrorPath:"+context.LastError.Path +
                                                ", RequestGUID:"+context.RequestId.ToString() +
                                            "</detail>\n" + 
				                "      </soapenv:Fault>\n" + 
				                "   </soapenv:Body>\n" + 
				                "</soapenv:Envelope>")</set-body>
            </return-response>
          </otherwise>
        </choose>
      </when>
      <otherwise />
    </choose>
  </on-error>
</policies>

    - To add a policy, place the cursor at the desired insertion point and select a policy from the sidebar.

  <backend />
  <outbound />
  <on-error />

          <set-body template="none">@("<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv=\"http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/\">\n" + 
				        "   <soapenv:Body>\n" + 
				        "      <soapenv:Fault>\n" + 
				        "         <faultcode>REQUEST-VALIDATION-FAILED</faultcode>\n" + 
				        "         <faultstring>INVALID-BODY</faultstring>\n" + 
				        "      </soapenv:Fault>\n" + 
				        "   </soapenv:Body>\n" + 
				        "</soapenv:Envelope>")</set-body>
        </return-response>
      </otherwise>
    </choose>
    <find-and-replace from="{{InWSSecUser}}" to="{{VANUsername}}" />
    <find-and-replace from="{{InWSSecPass}}" to="{{VANPassword}}" />
    <set-backend-service base-url="{{VANTx511URL}}" />
  </inbound>
  <backend>
    <forward-request timeout="120" fail-on-error-status-code="true" />
  </backend>
  <outbound>
    <choose>
      <when condition="@((context.Response.Body) != null)">
        <set-variable name="responseBody" value="@(context.Response.Body.As<string>(preserveContent: true))" />
        <set-variable name="responseDataCheck" value="@{
                    String respBodyStr      = "";
                    String respPart      = "";
                    respBodyStr = (String)context.Variables["responseBody"]; 
                    respPart = respBodyStr.Substring(100,200);
                    return "VAN_ContractChangeFullSurrdr_Tx511, OUTBOUND, SUCCESS, RequestGUID["+context.RequestId.ToString()+"], ResponsePart["+respPart+"]";
                }" />
        <log-to-eventhub logger-id="jp-vantage-api-logger" partition-id="2">@("{\"LogData\" : \'"+context.Variables["responseDataCheck"]+"\'}")</log-to-eventhub>
      </when>
      <otherwise>
        <set-variable name="responseNullCheck" value="@{  
                    return "VAN_ContractChangeFullSurrdr_Tx511, OUTBOUND, FAILURE, RequestGUID["+context.RequestId.ToString()+"], Error[Backend Response Is NULL]";
                }" />
        <log-to-eventhub logger-id="jp-vantage-api-logger" partition-id="2">@("{\"LogData\" : \'"+context.Variables["responseNullCheck"]+"\'}")</log-to-eventhub>
        <return-response>
          <set-status code="500" reason="BACKEND-RESPONSE-NULL" />
          <set-header name="Content-Type" exists-action="override">
            <value>text/xml</value>
          </set-header>
          <set-body template="none">@("<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv=\"http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/\">\n" + 
				        "   <soapenv:Body>\n" + 
				        "      <soapenv:Fault>\n" + 
				        "         <faultcode>RESPONSE-VALIDATION-FAILED</faultcode>\n" + 
				        "         <faultstring>BACKEND-RESPONSE-NULL</faultstring>\n" + 
				        "      </soapenv:Fault>\n" + 
				        "   </soapenv:Body>\n" + 
				        "</soapenv:Envelope>")</set-body>
        </return-response>
      </otherwise>
    </choose>
  </outbound>
  <on-error>
    <choose>
      <when condition="@((context.Response.Body) != null)">
        <set-variable name="errorResponseBody" value="@(context.Response.Body.As<string>(preserveContent: true))" />
        <choose>
          <when condition="@(((""+context.Variables["errorResponseBody"]).Contains("faultcode")))">
            <set-variable name="soapFaultCheck" value="@{
                            String SoapFaultInfo = ""+context.Variables["errorResponseBody"];
                            return "VAN_ContractChangeFullSurrdr_Tx511, ONERROR, FAILURE, RequestGUID["+context.RequestId.ToString()+"], SoapFault["+SoapFaultInfo+"]";
                        }" />
            <log-to-eventhub logger-id="jp-vantage-api-logger" partition-id="2">@("{\"LogData\" : \'"+context.Variables["soapFaultCheck"]+"\'}")</log-to-eventhub>
          </when>
          <otherwise>
            <set-variable name="errorCheck" value="@{
                            String ErrorInfo = ""+context.LastError.Source+","+context.LastError.Reason+","+context.LastError.Message+","+context.LastError.Section+","+context.LastError.Path;
                            return "VAN_ContractChangeFullSurrdr_Tx511, ONERROR, FAILURE, RequestGUID["+context.RequestId.ToString()+"], ErrorMessage["+ErrorInfo+"]";
                        }" />
            <log-to-eventhub logger-id="jp-vantage-api-logger" partition-id="2">@("{\"LogData\" : \'"+context.Variables["errorCheck"]+"\'}")</log-to-eventhub>
            <return-response>
              <set-status code="@(context.Response.StatusCode)" reason="@(context.LastError.Reason)" />
              <set-header name="Content-Type" exists-action="override">
                <value>text/xml</value>
              </set-header>
              <set-header name="RequestGUID" exists-action="override">
                <value>@(context.RequestId.ToString())</value>
              </set-header>
              <set-header name="ErrorSource" exists-action="override">
                <value>@(context.LastError.Source)</value>
              </set-header>
              <set-header name="ErrorReason" exists-action="override">
                <value>@(context.LastError.Reason)</value>
              </set-header>
              <set-header name="ErrorMessage" exists-action="override">
                <value>@(context.LastError.Message)</value>
              </set-header>
              <set-header name="ErrorScope" exists-action="override">
                <value>@(context.LastError.Scope)</value>
              </set-header>
              <set-header name="ErrorSection" exists-action="override">
                <value>@(context.LastError.Section)</value>
              </set-header>
              <set-header name="ErrorPath" exists-action="override">
                <value>@(context.LastError.Path)</value>
              </set-header>
              <set-header name="ErrorStatusCode" exists-action="override">
                <value>@(context.Response.StatusCode.ToString())</value>
              </set-header>
              <set-body template="none">@("<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv=\"http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/\">\n" + 
				                "   <soapenv:Body>\n" + 
				                "      <soapenv:Fault>\n" + 
				                "         <faultcode>"+context.LastError.Reason+"</faultcode>\n" + 
				                "         <faultstring>"+context.LastError.Message+"</faultstring>\n" + 
                                "           <detail>"+"StatusCode:"+context.Response.StatusCode+", ErrorSource:"+context.LastError.Source +
                                                ", ErrorScope:"+context.LastError.Scope+", ErrorSection:"+context.LastError.Section +
                                                ", ErrorPath:"+context.LastError.Path +
                                                ", RequestGUID:"+context.RequestId.ToString() +
                                            "</detail>\n" + 
				                "      </soapenv:Fault>\n" + 
				                "   </soapenv:Body>\n" + 
				                "</soapenv:Envelope>")</set-body>
            </return-response>
          </otherwise>
        </choose>
      </when>
      <otherwise />
    </choose>
  </on-error>
</policies>
